intro: Boerhavia spicata, commonly known as redroot lovegrass, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in dense spikes. The plant has fibrous roots and is often found in dry, disturbed soils.
